alert.note: Alert for Interior Cumberland Highlands; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 3:51AM EST until January 23 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOWFALL TONIGHT INTO MONDAY... .The next system in the ongoing active weather pattern is forecast to pass through southern New England tonight before exiting through the Gulf of Maine on Monday. This will bring another round of snowfall to the region. Heaviest snowfall rates are expected to be overnight tonight into Monday morning, with travel impacts expected for the morning commute. With snow expected to last into the late afternoon and early evening hours, travel may also be slick for the evening commute. Snow may be wet and sticky, which may increase power outage risk. Power outage risk increases further as winds turn gusty out of the northwest behind the storm system on Monday afternoon into Monday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 6 inches. * WHERE...Portions of south central and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 4 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...An area of low pressure will bring a period of snowfall to the region. Travel will be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on roads. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
